profile.name: Alan
profile.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
profile.description:
I am a passionate, intellectually restless person who is always looking to learn and know the ins and outs of this life.

I have a great passion for programming. I aspire to develop my seniority and bring my growing polymathic knowledge to my enironment and to the most groundbreaking websites and apps of the moment offering the best solutions either as Front End, Back End or Full Stack.

In a team I am a promoter of teamwork, empathy and good communication; I am assertive with mentorship spirit. I love to help people bring out the best in themselves, supporting them and helping them to be confident.

interestingFacts.fact:
I am passionate about philosophy and psychology. I am currently writing a book on philosophy and wellbeing focusing on what I consider to be one of the scarcest resources and of which we, human beings, are the source: love. Seen in a
completely new and even avant-garde way.
I do know to play some musical instruments and I must remark the love of ethnical music of around the world.
I love the world of Graphic Design, UX and UI, so I also learn about it by myself.
I'm a person who cares about others. So I decided to study two of the big themes in my live. Even though I couldn't finish those careers as I decided to study IT.
They are a great way to tell fantastic and deep stories that can get to your heart!

challenges.description:
Íntegro is a consumer services company that offers itself as a nexus to provide personalised services acting as such between client and company.

I am currently solely responsible for the design and development of Íntegro's website. I advise on the technologies to be used, create the architecture of the company's website and decide on the technologies to be used, as well as the hosting. I also work as a graphic designer, creating flayers, company logos and the design of the UX and UI. I do it all on my own.

Development of a front-end web app in an Agile Scrum environment.

It's a wonderful experience with a great team. Learning from each other, proposing solutions between all of us, we have come a long way. Understanding and camaraderie are our daily bread. Fears go away, you make friends and connect with people from whom you always have something to learn. 

Developing front end with TypeScript for the first time was not too difficult thanks to the JavaScript base. I gained knowledge of token implementation. I'm excited about the open and flexible way of programming we have. We are always looking for standalone components that have the greatest flexibility of implementation. As our CEO says, "the component should not know what the other component is doing", which makes for an extremely dynamic programme. 

For the first time I was working in parallel and relying on a specialised UX and UI team, so I had to practice good communication, without fear, asking all the necessary questions so that everything goes smoothly. Better to ask and do it well than to do it without knowing and regret it later, double work.
